title: Drawing, "View of Snow Covered Mount Chimborazo Drawn Near Guanojo and Guaranda, Ecuador", June 12, 1857
medium: Graphite,  brush and white gouache on cream-colored paper
markings: Stamped in ink at lower left:  Lugt 457c
inscribed: Inscribed in graphite, with numbers and letters througout; again,at top right:  Near Guanojo(near Guaranda) / June 12th //57: again, at left of upper right: a- light spot / b- Much broken up brown and green / k- sometimes covered with / snow thinly; again, at upper right:  2- Green Emerald / 3-Rich warm green / 4-Green /5- Soft smooth golden Brown / 6- Dark spots / 7-Rich greenish Brown/ 8 Brown ring (?) of green / 9-Beautiful variety of 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8 in streaks / 10- Trees clambering(?) up sides near top brown; again, at lower left:  Double sketch; and again, at bottom left: c Rich orange earth / d Blackish with streks of color and white spots / e- Purplish brown with patches of grass / f- White yellowish earth / g- more bluish than e / h Grayish yellow / i Rich green
description: Horizontal view of valley, foothills, and ridges stretching out toward the left as the snowcapped peak rises in the central background.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "View of Snow Covered Mount Chimborazo Drawn Near Guanojo and Guaranda, Ecuador", June 12, 1857.
June 12, 1857. Graphite,  brush and white gouache on cream-colored paper. Gift of Louis P. Church. 1917-4-221.
